reviews.review_msg: Very knowledgeable on pharmacology, asks good questions and can help you understand the trickier concepts well. Learned a lot and would take again.

Amazing prof! He's such a kind person, and he explains things extremely well. If I was ever confused about something in the textbook, I understood it after he went over it in the lecture. The practice quizzes he assigns on connect really helped me learn and remember things. His exams are not difficult and if you study you will get a good mark

The material for this class is heavy and has a lot of memorization but his exams only test on content in lectures and extra stuff that he posts. Makes it enjoyable and the 5 min breaks for discussion during lectures is very useful. He is really helpful as well.
awesome class. content heavy but he makes it fun to relate to. wish he teaches other courses in the HSCI.
Wrote my exam today and it was fairly straightforward. Really enjoys the class and the exam was fair.
He is very good at the integration of the content. I have taken phys before and Bassam makes the integration to phys and clinical applications very smooth. Really enjoying the class.

Very clear at explaining the lecture slides. Willing to answer questions at any time and approachable. Older lectures are available online but going to class can help. 3 exams were totally fair! Would take another course with him!

Class is based on lectures. There are only 3 midterms in the semester, which are not cumulative, so it's pretty easy. They were online and open book.  As long as you read through the slides, your good. Lots of memorization.

This class is based on 3 exams that come directly out of the lecture slides, reading is important to complete your understanding but no material will be tested that was not mentioned in lecture. His teaching skills are pretty average, but enthusiastic :P He genuinely wants you to succeed in his class and he is very accommodating .

As mentioned, 323 is a straight memorization course around drug names, functions and their agonists/antagonists. Most of it is from the slides, but he emphasizes some things that'll be on the midterms during lectures (which were pretty optional as long as you have a friend going). He's a nice guy, but his explanations are very unclear.

120% Hardcore memory class. Attendance is not mandatory, but he tends to mark the exam easier for people who show up on the lecture. The course content is interesting if you enjoy it. (2 out of 3 best midterm will be used) Friendly reminder: The last midterm is a bitxx so make sure you work extremely hard on that if you want to get a decent grade.
100% memorization class! Lecture is kind of dry and attendance is not really important. Memorize everything in his slides and you will pass.

He is rude, not a very good teacher, does not wanna come to class, does not know his material, tedious exams that do not test ur knowledge instead test ur memorizing skills. All in all it is a very very bad class!

This class would have been better in three one-hour lectures rather than one three-hour lecture. The course content is easy, though memorizing the names of drugs gets tedious. Compared to 3rd year MBB courses, this course required minimal studying. Regardless of how the course was taught and how the exams were graded, it was easy to get an A.

Agree with the comments below; unprepared for lectures, unfair marker, and he could care less you actually learn something or not. Late for appointments, and a not so friendly attitude towards students when met in person.
Very rude prof. He has no interest in coming to class to teach. Spends many minutes during class searching the textbook to tell us stuff;we can do that at home ourselves.

I would avoid this prof if possible. Exams were okay, claims that the textbook is absolutely necessary when it is not, and he is condescending when you talk to him. The lectures are also boring - duller than most
